Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Req: Students must have taken Physics 135-1 OR Physics 125-1 OR [Gen_Eng 205-2 AND 205-3] OR [Gen_Eng 206-2 AND 206-3] to register for this class.

Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.
Add Consent: Department Consent Required
title: WCAS PHYSICS 135-2-01 General Physics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This is a three-quarter sequence in calculus-based classical physics with an introduction to modern physics in the third quarter. It is intended for science and engineering majors and premedical students.

PHYS135-2 is the second part of the 135 sequence on General Physics intended for science and engineering majors, as well as premedical students. 135-2 deals with electric and magnetic phenomena in their various forms and manifestations. Specific topics include:
Static electric fields, static magnetic fields, DC and AC circuits, time-dependent electric and magnetic fields, Maxwell's equations.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisites: MATH 220-0, MATH 224-0, and MATH 230-0 or equivalent; MATH 230-0 may be taken concurrently with PHYSICS 135-1. Concurrent registration in the corresponding quarter of PHYSICS 136-1,2,3 (laboratory). Prior physics is not necessary. PHYSICS 135-1,2,3 are sequential prerequisites.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Teaching will consist of a combination of lectures, demonstrations, and discussion sections (total of four hours each week; discussion sections will be on Thursday).

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be based on performance in quizzes, two midterm exams, and one final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Fundamentals of Physics 10th Extended Edition by Jearl Walker
